result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig Delaney Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Go Armed with Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
*Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
*Upon successful completion of conditions of probation, Court will grant expungement.

records.addlTxt: Upon successful completion of conditions of probation, Court will grant expungement.

Defendant Craig Delaney in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court grants defense motion for an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Craig Delaney in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Craig Delaney in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-27-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-16-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Craig Delaney in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.24  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5-19-2015 at 1:30pm
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:  04/20/15
